plugin.name: Annotation Processing Tool
plugin.description: Provides support for annotation processing integrated into the IDE, as opposed to running as a part of the compilation process. The plugin supports configuration of individual project modules and JARs with annotation processors. Annotation processing kicks in whenever a file's content changes, either due to being saved in the IDE or as a result of external changes; renaming, moving, and deletion of a file also invokes annotation processing. Those who are familiar with annotation processing in the Eclipse IDE will find this plugin's mechanics very similar.
